text: I'm Amy Chua I'm a professor at Yale Law
School and you might know me from my
memoir Battle Hymn of the tiger mother
which caused a bit of a fuss some years
ago I'm focusing now not so much on
early childhood issues but kind of what
young adults need to succeed in the
workplace these days here are my tips
don't be afraid to fail I always tell my
daughters never not do something because
you're afraid you might fail go for it
and remember that hard work discipline
and perseverance can overcome a lot
learn to express yourself and convey
your unique personality
don't be an anonymous lemming it doesn't
matter how many skills you have or how
much knowledge you have if nobody knows
you have them or what you want people to
do with them it's not enough just to
have really good scores and really good
grades people want leaders and dynamism
people who think outside the box
so ask why maybe you have a faster
shorter better way than everybody else
even the experts
